p.b: In response to the coronavirus outbreak, the Brooklyn City School District will remain closed now through the end of the 2019-2020 school year per Governor DeWine’s order. The District will provide additional information on end of the year announcements over the next several weeks. In the meantime, the District has moved to a Level 3 Distance Learning Plan during this extended school closure to support our students. All information can be found here on the District website. If you have any questions about where to find information, please call 216-485-8100. Thank you for your patience as we work through these challenging times and stay safe.

h1.span: Ohio Governor Extends School Closure Through Friday, May 1st

span.p: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine extended the school closure period through Friday, May 1st for all public, private and charter schools during his daily press conference on March 30th. His administration will continue re-evaluating the status of school closure over this forthcoming 30 days as well. The District has developed a multiple-leveled extended closure plan to support our students, which includes information on distance learning, grade and class specific instruction, available learning resources, school meal opportunities and special education supports. Parents and students can find all the above information on the homepage of the District’s website. Thank you to everyone involved during this unprecedented time, for their hard work, flexibility and dedication to showing their Hurricane Pride.
